description.narrative:
This project is partnership with the Cambodia Development Resource Institute (CDRI). CDRI is a private non-profit independent development policy research institute registered under Cambodian legislation with Council of Minister on 2000.
Governments across the world in 2015 committed to reducing inequality and eradicating poverty under the SGDs. Cambodia has made significant progress in attaining the Millennium Development Goals. Since 1990, the country has more than halved extreme poverty and maternalmortality, achieved nearly universal primary education enrollment, and made significant progress in combating HIV/AIDS. Cambodia grew at an average rateof 7.6% from 1994-2015, and became a lower middle-income economy in 2015. This growth was driven by exports of goods and services (mainly garments and tourism), which grew 19.6% a year over the same period. Economic growth for 2018 will remain robust at around 7 percent according to the IMF. The percentage of Cambodians living under the national povertyline fell from 47.8% in 2007 to 13.5% in 2014, according to official estimates. Cambodia#s tax to GDP ratio is over 15% in 2016. As a lower middle-income economy, Cambodiais facing new challenges to sustaining strong economic growth.
To prepare for these new challenges, this project is being commissioned because Oxfam and CDRI recognize that inequality is a growing concern in Cambodia. This project is part of Oxfam#s global EvenIt Up campaign to reduce within-country extreme inequality around the world. It will explore the drivers of inequality in Cambodia and present a menu of policy options to reduce inequality. The report will be launched during a public event in April 2018 with the aim to contribute to high level policy dialogues on relations between fiscal policies and reducing inequality.

participating-org.narrative: CDRI is a non profit organization and Cambodia's leading independent development policy research institute. Our vision in Cambodia is: CDRI's vision is for a prosperous, inclusive and integrated Cambodia that continues to make progress in sustainable development and poverty reduction, democratization, natural resource management and gender equity. CDRI is and dependent and resilient centre ofresearch excellence for innovative ideas to influence policy that impacts on Cambodia's development. CDRI practices good governanceand institutional learning that lead to effective operation and performance. the practise of transparency, accountability and practicality have been carried out including taxation,auditing, banking system transaction. Moreover, CDRI has worked hard to Cambodianise it senior and middle management. Thus, it is well organized and well equipped to effectively undertake its programmes and projectsin partnership with Cambodians government agencies and their international development partners, other research and tertiary education institutions and civil society organizations.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
